asgn2Aircraft

Class Aircraft

  • java.lang.Object
    • asgn2Aircraft.Aircraft
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    A380, B747

    public abstract class Aircraft
extends java.lang.Object
    The Aircraft class provides facilities for modelling a commercial jet aircraft with multiple travel classes. New aircraft types are created by explicitly extending this class and providing the necessary configuration information. In particular, Aircraft maintains a collection of currently booked passengers, those with a Confirmed seat on the flight. Queueing and Refused bookings are handled by the main Simulator class. The class maintains a variety of constraints on passengers, bookings and movement between travel classes, and relies heavily on the asgn2Passengers hierarchy. Reports are also provided for logging and graphical display.
    Author:
    hogan

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aircraft

        public Aircraft(java.lang.String flightCode,
        int departureTime,
        int first,
        int business,
        int premium,
        int economy)
         throws AircraftException
        Constructor sets flight info and the basic size parameters.
        Parameters:
        flightCode - String containing flight ID
        departureTime - int scheduled departure time
        first - int capacity of First Class
        business - int capacity of Business Class
        premium - int capacity of Premium Economy Class
        economy - int capacity of Economy Class
        Throws:
        AircraftException - if isNull(flightCode) OR (departureTime <=0) OR ({first,business,premium,economy} <0)

    • Method Detail

      • cancelBooking

        public void cancelBooking(Passenger p,
                 int cancellationTime)
                   throws PassengerException,
                          AircraftException
        Method to remove passenger from the aircraft - passenger must have a confirmed seat prior to entry to this method.
        Parameters:
        p - Passenger to be removed from the aircraft
        cancellationTime - int time operation performed
        Throws:
        PassengerException - if Passenger is not Confirmed OR cancellationTime is invalid. See Passenger.cancelSeat(int)
        AircraftException - if Passenger is not recorded in aircraft seating

      • confirmBooking

        public void confirmBooking(Passenger p,
                  int confirmationTime)
                    throws AircraftException,
                           PassengerException
        Method to add a Passenger to the aircraft seating. Precondition is a test that a seat is available in the required fare class
        Parameters:
        p - Passenger to be added to the aircraft
        confirmationTime - int time operation performed
        Throws:
        PassengerException - if Passenger is in incorrect state OR confirmationTime OR departureTime is invalid. See Passenger.confirmSeat(int, int)
        AircraftException - if no seats available in Passenger fare class.

        public java.lang.String finalState()
        State dump intended for use in logging the final state of the aircraft. (Supplied)
        Returns:
        String containing dump of final aircraft state

        Returns:
        boolean true if aircraft full; false otherwise

      • flyPassengers

        public void flyPassengers(int departureTime)
                   throws PassengerException
        Method to finalise the aircraft seating on departure. Effect is to change the state of each passenger to Flown. departureTime parameter allows for rescheduling
        Parameters:
        departureTime - int actual departureTime from simulation
        Throws:
        PassengerException - if Passenger is in incorrect state See Passenger.flyPassenger(int).

        public Bookings getBookings()
        Method to return an Bookings object containing the Confirmed booking status for this aircraft.
        Returns:
        Bookings object containing the status.

        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • upgradeBookings

        public void upgradeBookings()
        Method to upgrade Passengers to try to fill the aircraft seating. Called at departureTime. Works through the aircraft fare classes in descending order of status. No upgrades are possible from First, so we consider Business passengers (upgrading if there is space in First), then Premium, upgrading to fill spaces already available and those created by upgrades to First), and then finally, we do the same for Economy, upgrading where possible to Premium.
